Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of a Standardized Operating Procedure and Educational Program on Adherence to Intraoperative Lung Protective Ventilation

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients undergoing general anesthesia, with 164 patients meeting inclusion criteria.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved implementing an SOP and educational program.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of a standardized operating procedure (SOP) with an educational program on adherence to intraoperative lung protective ventilation (IOLPV).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was adherence to the IOLPV bundle, measured over one month pre- and post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomization and blinding were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 164 patients were analyzed (Group A: 82 pre-intervention, Group B: 82 post-intervention).

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 164 patients were analyzed (Group A: 82 pre-intervention, Group B: 82 post-intervention).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Adherence to the IOLPV bundle increased significantly in Group B (Group A: 4%, Group B: 24%; p < 0.001).
